methods.javadoc:
Returns a file object that is the help topic directory for the given file.  
 This method is useful for finding the help topic directory when the given 
 file doesn't live directly under a help topic.
methods.name: getHelpTopicDir
methods.comment:
Returns a file object that is the help topic directory for the given file.  
 This method is useful for finding the help topic directory when the given 
 file doesn't live directly under a help topic.

methods.name: isRemote
methods.comment: Returns true if the given String represents a remote resource

return.comment: true if the given String represents a remote resource

methods.name: isRemote
methods.comment: Returns true if the given Path represents a remote resource

return.comment: true if the given Path represents a remote resource

methods.name: isRemote
methods.comment: Returns true if the given URI represents a remote resource

return.comment: true if the given URI represents a remote resource

methods.name: locateImageReference
methods.comment:
Turn an HTML IMG reference into a location object that has resolved path info.  This will 
 locate files based upon relative references, specialized help system references (i.e., 
 help/topics/...),  and absolute URLs.

return.comment: an absolute path; null if the URI is remote

methods.name: locateReference
methods.comment:
Turn an HTML HREF reference into an absolute path.  This will 
 locate files based upon relative references, specialized help system references (i.e., 
 help/topics/...),  and absolute URLs.

return.comment: an absolute path; null if the URI is remote
